ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
fortran_compiler:
- gfortran
fortran_compiler_version:
- '14'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.description:
The Geophysical Institute Permafrost Laboratory (GIPL) model uses
the effect of snow layers and subsurface soil thermal properties
to simulate ground temperatures and active layer thickness by
numerically solving the 1D heat diffusion equation with phase
change using finite-difference techniques. This version of the GIPL
model includes a Basic Model Interface (BMI) created by Kang Wang
(university of Colorado Boulder).
about.summary: A numerical model of soil properties in polar regions.

name: gipl

about.description:
The Geophysical Institute Permafrost Laboratory (GIPL) model uses
the effect of snow layers and subsurface soil thermal properties
to simulate ground temperatures and active layer thickness by
numerically solving the 1D heat diffusion equation with phase
change using finite-difference techniques. This version of the GIPL
model includes a Basic Model Interface (BMI) created by Kang Wang
(university of Colorado Boulder).
about.summary: A numerical model of soil properties in polar regions.

about.description:
The Geophysical Institute Permafrost Laboratory (GIPL) model uses
the effect of snow layers and subsurface soil thermal properties
to simulate ground temperatures and active layer thickness by
numerically solving the 1D heat diffusion equation with phase

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "gipl" %}
{% set version = "1.3.1" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://github.com/permamodel/GIPL-BMI-Fortran/archive/v{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 0b1af62675169d629d564b35c0f4ea8adc16651ae59615fab9e53ecfb623b774

build:
  number: 2
  skip: true  # [win and vc<14]

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('fortran') }}
    - {{ compiler('cxx') }}  # [win]
    - {{ stdlib("c") }}
    - make  # [unix]
    - cmake

test:
  source_files:
    - data
  commands:
    - run_bmigipl_model --help
    - run_bmigipl_model data/gipl_config.cfg

about:
  home: https://csdms.colorado.edu/wiki/Model:GIPL
  license: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: "A numerical model of soil properties in polar regions."
  description: |
    The Geophysical Institute Permafrost Laboratory (GIPL) model uses
    the effect of snow layers and subsurface soil thermal properties
    to simulate ground temperatures and active layer thickness by
    numerically solving the 1D heat diffusion equation with phase
    change using finite-difference techniques. This version of the GIPL
    model includes a Basic Model Interface (BMI) created by Kang Wang
    (university of Colorado Boulder).
  doc_url: https://csdms.colorado.edu/wiki/Model_help:GIPL
  dev_url: https://github.com/permamodel/GIPL_BMI_Fortran

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - mdpiper

about.description:
The Geophysical Institute Permafrost Laboratory (GIPL) model uses
the effect of snow layers and subsurface soil thermal properties
to simulate ground temperatures and active layer thickness by
numerically solving the 1D heat diffusion equation with phase
change using finite-difference techniques. This version of the GIPL
model includes a Basic Model Interface (BMI) created by Kang Wang
(university of Colorado Boulder).
about.summary: A numerical model of soil properties in polar regions.
